Message.Title: 7 top reasons to buy msft (All-in)
Message.Msg: 1) Revolutionary Windows 8 allows hybridization of touchpads to PC, most if not all portable devices in the future will have W8. Everything from cashier machines, atm, laptops, etc will have W8. Pure touchpads will be thrown to the toddlers so they can swipe the angry birds. 2) Surface Pro is sold out and ramping up production. It is ONLY the second version of Surface. 3) Xbox Kinect release this summer will be the first game console to eliminate the use of joysticks. Games motion control will be done with players hands and body motions. 4) Bing is finding more incomes and usage through FB (it used to be a huge loss). 5) Still trading at the bottom, with PE in the low teens. 6) Solid as a rock with $60 plus billions in cash. 7) Most banks target range is $33-35 (without the success of Surface Pro and Xbox kinect)

Message.Title: Surface pro 128 gb, No. 2 best seller at Best Buy among all tablets
Message.Msg: Despite severe stock shortages and a high price the Microsoft Surface pro has still managed to make it onto Best Buy’s Bet Seller list, currently sitting in 4th spot behind much, much cheaper Amazon Kindle and Samsung Galaxy Tab. The Windows 8 tablet has been seeing severe supply shortages, but Microsoft has promised to restock this weekend, and is currently taking pre-orders for delivery later in the month. Interestingly on the same page the Surface RT tablet holds 12th spot, suggesting the Windows 8 tablet may see better success than its more limited sibling.

Topic.Title: 7 top reasons to buy msft (All-in)

Message.Msg: "WIN8 is revolutionary in compatability" HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA!!! The turd isn't even compatible with ITSELF, genius. "Because of its simplicity, the Metro flavor of IE also lacks certain key features. It doesn't support plug-ins. Any site that requires Flash, Microsoft Silverlight, or other add-ons won't work. Trying to install a plug-in just switches you to the desktop flavor. You can't create and manage a list of favorites divided by folder and subfolder. Your only option is to pin your favorite Web sites to the Start screen, where there's no effective way to organize them, especially as they grow in number. So I can see the Metro edition of IE as good for quick browsing to relatively simple sites, but not as a tool for people who want to use the browser for work, entertainment, or other common tasks." CNET-- News-- Microsoft IE10 in Windows 8: Metro style vs. desktop ...
